text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of learned the kitchen this is such a
special episode for me because I'm
showing you how to make my grandmother's
chicken soup it's like my number one
comfort food from me of all time it's
very simple to make as much as I love
this soup the way I make it which is
pretty much the same way she makes it I
always feel like hers comes out better
that's probably because she makes it the
ingredients for our super simple so I
want to take you over then before we get
started you're going to need some skin
on boning chicken legs very important
dark meat chicken an array of mixed
vegetables which are carrots onions
celery butternut squash potatoes some
tomato puree and a chicken bullion cube
and you're also going to need I'll show
you a little bit later on some small cut
pasta extra virgin olive oil salt and
pepper and if you want some Parmesan
Reggiano which I know I'm gonna eat on
top of this so umm okay this recipe is
the recipe for me when I go over there
in fact I went to Italy a couple years
ago in the summer it was July it was so
unbearably hot but the day I went to my
grandma's house the first day I was
there she asked me what I wanted to eat
and I asked her I wanted her Bravo
and my uncles were so mad because it's
hot they're like why do we have to eat
soup in July and my grandma was like
listen she's here she's eating her soup
and that's the end of it and I ate soup
in July I think like the entire time I
was there because that's like my thing
that I always asked her to make whenever
I see her okay so I have all my chopping
done let's go to stove and start cooking
I have a large soup pot preheating over
medium high heat with about two
tablespoons of extra-virgin olive oil
and I just salt and pepper in one side
of my chicken and then I'm going to just
put them seasoned side down wanna make
sure it's nice and hot and this is just
gonna cook for three to four minutes on
each side or until they develop a nice
golden brown color on
outside and took my chicken out after
I've been cooking it for a few minutes
on each side just to develop a little
golden color and now I'm going to add in
here all my veggies and I'm going to
season them with a little salt just to
draw out the moisture and let these cook
for about five seven minutes or until we
start to cook down and veggies are
starting to cook down now I'm going to
add my chicken back in get it nice like
that and I'm going to cover it with
water whoa a little bit more again neat
about I would say six and a half to
seven cups of water total I'm going to
add in some of the tomato puree or you
can use leftover marinara sauce or even
fresh tomatoes if you want it just some
kind of tomato product in there okeydoke
our bullion cube and now I'm going to
let this come up to a boil and then I'm
going to lower the heat to medium-low
and I'm going to simmer and cook for
about two hours after a couple of hours
I've just taken out the chicken and now
I'm getting rid of the skin and just
shredding the meat with my fingers you
can also use two forks if you want to
but I've just let it cool down for about
ten minutes so it's cool enough for me
to handle with my fingers just go ahead
and shred all the meat and then I will
go back to the stove to finish it off
now my vegetable base is all nice and
cooked my shredded chickens right here
to the side now this is completely
optional but this is the way I know how
to eat this because I do I've eaten in
my whole life I'm gonna just puree the
vegetable base but you can definitely
leave it chunky if you want to I like to
puree most of it and leave some chunks
to my pureed vegetables I'm going to add
a bit of water just to fit it out touch
give this a stir put in the heat back up
to medium-high a little bit more water
and I'm gonna let this come up to a boil
and then once it comes to a boil I'm
going to put in my pasta and my chicken
and I'm going to let it cook them till
the pastas
fully cooked through after it came up to
a boil I added my pasta and my shredded
chicken and I let it cook for about 10
minutes and now it's perfect
it's nice and thick it's just like I
remember eating it as a kid I like that
now of course pure eyeing the vegetable
is a total optional thing but for me
it's a must now I should put some

it truly does I don't know why ah I wish
